docs.title: General
docs.text:
Docweld is a web-based application designed to simplify welding project management, streamline communication, and save time and money by digitizing documentation processes. It provides a centralized platform for managing, sharing, and storing information related to welding projects.

Key features of Docweld include:

  • Project Management: This feature allows users to create and manage welding projects, providing a centralized location for organizing and tracking project details, participants, activities, and documentation.
  • Weld Log Management: This feature enables users to manage weld logs and individual welds, including weld details, events, and photos. This ensures comprehensive documentation and traceability for each weld.
  • Document Management: This feature provides a means to store and organize essential project-related documents, such as WPS, material certificates, filler material certificates, and photos, making them easily accessible to all project participants.
  • Project Reporting: This feature enables users to generate comprehensive PDF reports of welding projects, including welds, events, participants, and documents. These reports can be shared with customers or third-party certifiers as needed.
  • User Management: This feature allows project managers to assign roles and responsibilities to different project participants, ensuring clear communication and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.

By providing these key features, Docweld helps users efficiently manage welding projects, reduce the risk of errors or inconsistencies, and improve overall project outcomes.

docs.title: Add new alloy
docs.text:
Alloys are essential when creating new parent materials in the parent material library. If the desired alloy is missing, it can be added to the Alloy library and used when creating a new parent material.

Admin users can follow these steps to add new alloys to the library:

  1. Click on the App menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen and select "Material Management" (B).

  2. Navigate to the "Alloys" tab (C).

  3. Click on the "Add" (D) button to add a new alloy.

  4. Fill out the alloy name.

  5. Click on the "Create" button (E) to add the new alloy to the library.

By following these steps, admin users can manage the alloy library, ensuring that all relevant alloys are accurately documented and easily accessible to all projects.

docs.title: Add new user
docs.text:
Admin users can add other users to Docweld by following these steps:

  1. Navigate to User Management by clicking the App menu (A) and choosing User Management (B).
  2. To add a new user, click on the arrow icon (C) to expand the "Add user" window.
  3. Fill out the required information for the new user, including their first name, last name, email address, password, and admin status (D).
  4. Once all the information has been entered, click on the "Add user" button (E) to create the new user account.

By following these steps, admin users can add new users to Docweld and grant them the necessary access to the welding projects.

docs.title: Create new filler material
docs.text:
Admin users can create new parent materials to the material library by following these steps:

  1. Click on the App menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen and select "Material Management" (B).
  2. Navigate to the "Filler materials" tab (C).

  3. Click on the "Create" (D) button to add new filler material.

  4. Fill out the filler material name.

  5. Click on the "Create" button (E) to create the new filler material and add it to the library.

By following these steps, admin users can manage the filler material library, ensuring that all relevant filler materials are accurately documented and easily accessible to all projects.

docs.title: Create new parent material
docs.text:
Admin users can create new parent materials to the material library by following these steps:

  1. Click on the App menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen and select "Material Management" (B).

  2. Click on the "Create" (C) button to add a new parent material.

  3. Fill out the required information for the new parent material, including its alloy, type, dimensions, and thickness.

  4. Once all the information has been entered, click on the "Create" button (D) to create the new parent material and add it to the library.

Info

If you cannot find the desired alloy from the dropdown list, you can create it in the Alloy library.

By following these steps, admin users can manage the parent material library, ensuring that all relevant parent materials are accurately documented and easily accessible to all projects.

docs.title: Edit company information
docs.text:
Company information, including the company logo, name, and address, is automatically added to the project report to provide relevant information about the company.

Admin users can edit this information by following these steps:

  1. Click on the App menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen and select "Settings" (B).

  2. Click on the "Edit" button (C).

  3. Edit the information as needed. To change the company logo, click on the image (D) and select a new image file.

  4. Once the information has been edited, click on the "Save" button (E) to update the company information.

By following these steps, admin users can ensure that the company information is up-to-date and accurately reflected in the project report, providing clear and concise information about the company to all relevant parties.

docs.title: Edit profile
docs.text:
Users can edit their profile information and add or change their profile picture by following these steps:

  1. Click on the User menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen and select "Profile" (B).
  2. Click on the "Edit" button (C).
  3. Edit the information as needed. To change the profile picture, click on the image (D) and select a new image file.
  4. Once the information has been edited, click on the "Save" button (E) to update the user information.

By following these steps, users can manage and update their information in Docweld, ensuring that their profile is accurate and up-to-date.

docs.title: Log out of Docweld
docs.text:
To log out of Docweld, follow these steps:

  1. Click on the User menu (A) located in the top-right corner of the screen.
  2. Select "Logout" (B) from the dropdown menu.

By following these steps, you can log out of Docweld, ensuring that your account is secure and that your information is protected.

docs.title: Login to Docweld
docs.text:
Docweld can be accessed using a web browser by entering the URL https://3wis.docweld.com/.

To log in to the app, users must first obtain login credentials from their company's admin user. The admin user will set up user accounts and provide login information to each user as needed.

docs.title: Add document to Documents page
docs.text:
To add a document to the Documents page of a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Expand the section where you want to add the document(s) by clicking the arrow (A).
  3. Drag the document into the "Click or drop files" field (B), or click on it to choose the file.

By following these steps, you can add documents to a project and keep all project-related documents organized in one place.

docs.title: Add section to Documents page
docs.text:
To add a new section to the Documents page of a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Click on the "Add section" button (A).
  3. Add a name for the section.
  4. Click on the "Add section" button (B) to create the new section.

Alternatively, you can also add a new section by clicking on the three-dot menu (C) and selecting "Add section" (D) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can add a new section to the Documents page of your project.

docs.title: Delete document in Documents page
docs.text:
To delete a document on the Documents page of a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Expand the section that contains the document you want to delete by clicking the arrow icon (A) next to the section name.
  3. Locate the document you want to delete and click on the three-dot menu (B) on the bottom right of the document preview.
  4. Select "Delete" (C) from the options provided to remove the document from the project.

By following these steps, you can delete documents from your project.

docs.title: Rename document in Documents page
docs.text:
To rename a document on the Documents page of a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Expand the section that contains the document you want to rename by clicking the arrow icon (A) next to the section name.
  3. Locate the document you want to rename and click on the three-dot menu (B) on the bottom right of the document preview.
  4. Select "Rename" (C) from the options provided.
  5. Add the new name for the document in the "Enter new name" field.
  6. Click on the "Rename" button (D) to save the changes.

By following these steps, you can rename documents on the Documents page of a project.

docs.title: Save sections in Documents page as templates
docs.text:
To save a document section as a template for later use, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Click on the three-dot menu (A).
  3. Select "Save as template" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can save document sections as templates for future use, and access them in the template library. This feature can save you time when creating new projects with similar document sections.

docs.title: View document in Documents page
docs.text:
To view a document on the Documents page of a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Documents page for the project.
  2. Expand the section that contains the document you want to view by clicking the arrow icon (A) next to the section name.
  3. Locate the document you want to view and click on the three-dot menu (B) on the bottom right of the document preview.
  4. Select "Open" (C) from the options provided. This will open the document in a new tab of your browser, where you can view or download it.

By following these steps, you can view any document on the Documents page of your project.

docs.title: Add project participant
docs.text:
To add a new project participant for a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Project Overview page for the project.

  2. Click on the "Add" button (A) located in the Participants section.

  3. Select the user from the dropdown menu (B). This menu displays app users from the user library.

  4. Choose the role of the participant from the "Participating as" list. This role is specific to the user's involvement in this project.
  5. Click on the "Add participant" button to add the user to the project.

By following these steps, you can add new participants to your project in Docweld. You can also edit or remove participants by clicking on the three-dot menu next to the participant's name.

docs.title: Edit project participant
docs.text:
To add a new project participant for a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Project Overview page for the project.
  2. Locate the participant you wish to edit in the Participants section.
  3. Click on the three-dot menu (A) next to their name.
  4. Select "Edit" (B) from the options provided.
  5. From the "Participating as" list (C), select the new role for the participant.
  6. After changes, click on the "Save changes" button.

By following these steps, you can edit a participant's role in the project.

docs.title: Remove project participant
docs.text:
To remove a participant from a project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Project Overview page for the project.
  2. Locate the participant you wish to remove from the project in the Participants section.
  3. Click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to their name.
  4. Select "Remove from project" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can remove participants from a project. This will not remove the user from the user library, but rather just their participation in the particular project.

docs.title: Approve project report
docs.text:
To approve a project report, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the reports page.
  2. Click on the "Approve" button (A) to approve the report. This will change the approval status from "Pending" to "Approved".

After following the steps above, you can approve the project report to indicate that it has been reviewed and accepted by the appropriate personnel. This is an important step to ensure the accuracy and completeness of project documentation, as well as to maintain a record of approvals.

docs.title: Generate project report
docs.text:
To generate a project report, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the reports page.
  2. Click on the "Generate report" button (A) to start the report generation process.
  3. Choose the sections (B) of the project documentation library that you want to be included in the report. You can select multiple sections by clicking on each one.
  4. Review the default company information (C) that is fetched from the company information page. If necessary, you can modify it to update the report with accurate information.
  5. Click on the "Generate" button to begin the report generation process. This will generate a new project report and add it to the report list with a running version number.
  6. After generation, you can add a note (E) to the "Note" column in the reports list.

By following these steps, you can quickly generate a project report, allowing you to share comprehensive project documentation with team members and stakeholders.

docs.title: Add project
docs.text:
To create a new project in Docweld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Projects page in Docweld.
  2. Click on the "Add" (A) button.
  3. Enter the project details, such as the project name, project number, customer, external reference, description, traceability of parent material, and traceability of filler material.
  4. Click on the "Add project" button (B) to create the new project.

By following these steps, you can create a new project in Docweld and begin managing your welding projects in a centralized platform.

docs.title: Archive project
docs.text:
To archive a project in Docweld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Projects page in Docweld.
  2. Find the project that you want to archive and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the project name.
  3. Select "Archive" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can archive a project in Docweld, helping to keep your project list organized and up-to-date.

To access your archived projects, click on the "Archived" tab (C) located on the Projects page.

docs.title: Delete project
docs.text:
To delete a project in Docweld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Projects page in Docweld.
  2. Find the project that you want to delete and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the project name.
  3. Select "Delete" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can delete a project in Docweld, which will help keep your project list organized and up-to-date. Deleting a project can be helpful if you no longer need the project or if it was created by mistake.

Info

Deleting a project will permanently remove it from Docweld, and all associated data will be lost. Be sure to download any necessary reports or documents before deleting a project.

docs.title: Duplicate project
docs.text:
When duplicating a project in Docweld, a new project is created with the same details as the original project. This can save time and effort when creating a new project that is similar to an existing one.

To duplicate a project in Docweld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Projects page in Docweld.
  2. Find the project that you want to duplicate and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the project name.
  3. Select "Duplicate" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can quickly create a new project based on an existing one, without having to manually enter all of the project details.

docs.title: Edit project
docs.text:
To edit project details, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the Projects page in Docweld.
  2. Find the project that you want to edit and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the project name.
  3. Select "Edit" (B) from the options provided.
  4. Edit the information as needed. You can modify project details such as the project name, project number, customer, external reference, description, traceability of parent material, and traceability of filler material.
  5. Once the changes have been made, click on the "Update project" button (C) to save the updated project information.

Alternatively, you can also click on the "Edit" button (D) on the project details window on the project overview page to access the editing feature.

By following these steps, you can easily edit project details in Docweld and keep your project information up-to-date.

docs.title: Add weld log
docs.text:
To create a new weld log into the project, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the weld logs page in your project.

  2. Click on the "Add" button (A) to create a new weld log.

  3. Enter the name and description for the weld log.

  4. To attach documents and add internal comments, follow these sub-steps:
  5. Click on the link icon (B) to open the document library of the project.
  6. Expand the section that contains the document you want to attach to the weld log by clicking the arrow icon (C) next to the section name.
  7. Locate the document you want to attach to the weld log and click on the three-dot menu (D) on the bottom right of the document preview.
  8. Select "Link" (E) from the options provided. This will attach (or "link") the document from the document library of the project to the weld log.
  9. You can attach another document by clicking on the "Add" button (F).
  10. You can remove the attachment by clicking on the trashcan icon (G). This will not remove the document from the document library of the project, it only removes it from the weld log by "removing the linking".
  11. Add a comment to the "Internal comment on documents" (H).
  12. When you have filled in the details and attached documents, click on the "Add weld log" button (I) to create the new weld log.

By following these steps, you can create a new weld log in your project and attach the necessary details and documents to it.

docs.title: Delete weld log
docs.text:
To delete a weld log, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the weld logs page.
  2. Find the weld log that you want to delete and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the weld log name.
  3. Select "Delete" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can delete a weld log, which will help keep your weld log list organized and up-to-date. Deleting a weld log can be helpful if you no longer need the weld log or if it was created by mistake.

Info

Deleting a weld log will permanently remove it from Docweld, and all associated data will be lost. Be sure to download any necessary information from the weld log before deleting it.

docs.title: Duplicate weld log
docs.text:
Duplicating a weld log can save time and effort when creating a new weld log that is similar to an existing one. Follow these steps to duplicate a weld log:

To duplicate a weld log, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the weld logs page.
  2. Find the weld log that you want to duplicate and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the weld log name.
  3. Select "Duplicate" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can quickly create a new weld log based on an existing one, without having to manually enter all of the weld log details.

docs.title: Edit weld log
docs.text:
To edit weld details, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the weld logs page.
  2. Find the weld log that you want to edit and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the weld log name.
  3. Select "Edit" (B) from the options provided.
  4. Edit the details as needed. You can modify the weld log name, description, and internal comments, and add or remove attachments.
  5. Once the changes have been made, click on the "Save" button (C) to save the updated weld log information.

By following these simple steps, you can edit the details of a weld log and keep your project information up-to-date.

docs.title: Add weld photo
docs.text:
To add a photo to a weld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld for which you want to add a photo.
  2. Drag and drop the photo file into the designated "Click or drop files" field (A). Alternatively, you can click on the field to choose the file from your device.

docs.title: Add weld
docs.text:
To create a new weld into the weld log, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld log where you want to add the new weld.
  2. Click on the "Add" button (A) to create a new weld.
  3. Fill in the required details for the new weld, including the weld number, position, remarks, and heat treatment (if applicable).

  4. Select parent materials by following these sub-steps:

    1. Click on the arrow (B) to open the dropdown list.
    2. Select the parent material from the dropdown list. You can select multiple parent materials.

    If the material you need is not available in the dropdown list, you can create it by clicking on "Create parent material" (C). This will open the "Create parent material" window (D), which allows you to quickly add a new parent material to the parent material library without having to navigate to the parent material library to create it.

  5. Filler materials are selected in the same way as parent materials. Follow these sub-steps: 1. Click on the arrow (E) to open the dropdown list. 2. Select the filler material from the dropdown list.

    If the material you need is not available in the dropdown list, you can create it by clicking on "Create filler material" (F). It will then be added to the filler material library.

  6. To attach WPS document(S), follow these sub-steps:

    1. Click on the link icon (G) to open the document library of the project.

    2. Expand the section that contains the document you want to attach to the weld by clicking the arrow icon (H) next to the section name.

    3. Locate the document you want to attach to the weld and click on the three-dot menu (I) on the bottom right of the document preview.

    4. Select "Link" (J) from the options provided. This will attach (or "link") the document from the document library of the project to the weld.

      You can attach another document by clicking on the "Add" button (K).

      You can remove the attachment by clicking on the trashcan icon (L). This will not remove the document from the document library of the project, it only removes it from the weld log by "removing the linking".

  7. When you have filled in the details and attached documents, click on the "Add weld" button (M) to create the new weld.

By following these steps, you can create a new weld in your project and attach the necessary details and documents to it.

docs.title: Add multiple welds
docs.text:
To quickly create multiple identical welds in the weld log, follow these steps:

  1. Switch the "Multiple" toggle switch (N) on. This will change the "Weld number" field (O) into "Weld number - from" and display a new field, "Weld number - to" (P).
  2. Enter the number of the first weld in the range into the "Weld number - from" field and the number of the last weld in the range into the "Weld number - to" field.

This will create a range of identical welds. For example, if "Weld number - from" is 1 and "Weld number - to" is 5, welds 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 will be created with the same details.

The steps for adding multiple welds are otherwise identical to adding a single weld.

docs.title: Delete weld photo
docs.text:
To delete a weld photo, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that has the photo you want to delete.
  2. Locate the photo you want to delete and click on the three-dot menu (A) on the bottom right of the photo preview.
  3. Select "Delete" (B) from the options provided.

Info

Deleting a weld photo will permanently remove it from Docweld. Before deleting it, be sure to download and archive it if you need it in the future. It's important to keep in mind that weld photos are not stored in the documents library, they are located solely within the weld details section.

docs.title: Delete weld
docs.text:
To delete a weld, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld log that has the weld you want to delete.
  2. Find the weld that you want to delete and click on the three-dot menu (A) located next to the weld log name.
  3. Select "Delete" (B) from the options provided.

By following these steps, you can delete a weld, which will help keep your weld list organized and up-to-date. Deleting a weld can be helpful if you no longer need the weld or if it was created by mistake.

Info

Deleting a weld will permanently remove it from Docweld, and all associated data will be lost. Be sure to download any necessary information from the weld before deleting it.

docs.title: Log event
docs.text:
Each weld can have different events logged. The ability to log an event depends on the user's role and the current status of the weld. Here are some examples:

  • Welding events can only be logged for welds that have not been welded yet or have been rejected by an NDT operator. Welding events can only be logged by welders.
  • Heat treatment events can only be logged for welds that have already been welded. Heat treatments can only be logged by a heat treatment operator.
  • NDT inspection events can only be logged for welds that have been welded and heat treated (if required). NDT inspections can only be logged by an NDT operator.

Admin users have the ability to log events on behalf of other users.

docs.title: Log welding event
docs.text:
To log a welding event, you need to meet the following prerequisites:

  • Participating in the project as a welder or having admin status.
  • Weld has a status that accepts a welding event (does not have other events logged such as welding or heat treatment events, but can be rejected by an NDT operator).

To log a welding event, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that you want to log the event.
  2. If prerequisites are met, the weld will have a button "Log weld" (A). Click on the button.
  3. Choose the time of the event (B), and if you are an admin, choose the welder from the dropdown list (C). If you are a basic user, your name is selected by default.
  4. When you have filled in the time (and the welder), click on the "Log" button (D) to create the new welding event.

By following these steps, you can create a new welding event for your weld. Logging of events helps ensure that the welding process is well-documented and traceable.

docs.title: Log heat treatment event
docs.text:
To log a heat treatment event, you need to meet the following prerequisites:

  • Participating in the project as a heat treatment operator or having admin status.
  • Weld has a status that accepts a heat treatment event (has welding event logged).

To log a heat treatment event, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that you want to log the event.
  2. If prerequisites are met, the weld will have a button "Log heat treatment" (A). Click on the button.
  3. Choose the time of the event (B), and if you are an admin, choose the heat treatment operator from the dropdown list (C). If you are a basic user, your name is selected by default.
  4. When you have filled in the time (and the heat treatment operator), click on the "Log" button (D) to create the new heat treatment event.

By following these steps, you can create a new heat treatment event for your weld. Logging of events helps ensure that the welding process is well-documented and traceable.

docs.title: Log NDT inspection event
docs.text:
To log an NDT inspection event, you need to meet the following prerequisites:

  • Participating in the project as an NDT operator or having admin status.
  • Weld has a status that accepts an NDT inspection event (has welding event logged and heat treatment event logged (if required)).

To log an NDT inspection event, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that you want to log the event.
  2. If prerequisites are met, the weld will have a button "Log NDT" (A). Click on the button.
  3. Choose the time of the event (B), comment on NDTs (C), and if you are an admin, choose the NDT operator from the dropdown list (D). If you are a basic user, your name is selected by default.
  4. Choose the NDT method(s) and the results for each method (E).
  5. When you have filled in the information, click on the "Log" button (F) to create the new NDT inspection event.

NDT inspection will be logged (G) into the events section. If you want to log another NDT inspection, you can click on the "Log NDT" button (H) again.

If any of the NDT inspection methods result in "Rejected" (H), the weld needs to be redone. The next event, therefore, will be "Log weld" (I).

By following these steps, you can create a new NDT inspection event for your weld. Proper documentation of the welding process is crucial, and logging events such as NDT inspections helps ensure that the highest standards are met. With a clear record of each step of the welding process, it is easy to identify any issues that may arise and address them quickly and efficiently.

docs.title: Rename weld photo
docs.text:
To rename a weld photo, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that has the photo you want to rename.
  2. Locate the photo you want to rename and click on the three-dot menu (A) on the bottom right of the photo preview. Select "Rename" (B) from the options provided.
  3. Add the new name for the document in the "Enter new name" field.
  4. Click on the "Rename" button (C) to save the changes.

docs.title: View weld photo
docs.text:
To view a weld photo, follow these steps:

  1. Navigate to the details page of the weld that has the photo you want to view.
  2. Locate the photo you want to view and click on the three-dot menu (A) on the bottom right of the photo preview. Select "Open" (B) from the options provided. This will open the photo in a new tab of your browser, where you can view or download it.

docs.title: General
docs.text:
The App menu (A) provides admin users with access to the following: Projects, Material Management, User Management, Template Management, and Settings. Basic users can only access the Projects through this menu, with the other menu items hidden.

By providing easy access to these features, the App menu allows users to quickly navigate and manage their welding projects more efficiently.

docs.title: Material management
docs.text:
Material management is a library for managing parent materials (A), filler materials (B), and alloys (C). These materials are used when creating new welds in projects, and alloys are used when creating new parent materials in the Parent material library (A).

Through this feature, users can add and manage different types of parent and filler materials, as well as add new alloys to the Alloy library. By maintaining these materials in a centralized location, users can easily reference and utilize them when creating new welds, reducing the risk of errors or inconsistencies in project-related materials.

docs.title: Settings
docs.text:
The Settings page displays important information about the company using the app, such as the company logo, name, address, and contact person.

This page provides a centralized location for managing company information, ensuring that it is always up-to-date and accurate. By keeping this information current, users can ensure that all project-related materials are consistently branded and easily recognizable.

docs.title: Template management
docs.text:
Template Management is a library for managing templates of the Documents page. Users can create templates by saving headers of the Documents page, and these templates are stored in this section.

This feature enables users to create standardized headers for project-related documents, which can be reused across different projects. By saving these headers as templates, users can save time and effort when organizing project-related documents, ensuring consistency and efficiency across all projects.

docs.title: User management
docs.text:
Admin users have the ability to manage user accounts through User management. This includes the ability to add new users, assign user roles (basic user or admin), delete user accounts, and deactivate user accounts as needed.

By managing user accounts through this feature, admin users can maintain control over who has access to the app and its associated projects. This provides a secure and efficient means to manage user accounts, ensuring that only authorized users have access to sensitive project-related information.

docs.title: Projects list
docs.text:
The Projects page serves as the start page of Docweld and includes the following:

  • Active projects (A): This tab displays active projects. Basic users can view the projects they are participating in, while admin users can view all projects associated with the company.
  • Archived projects (B): This tab displays archived projects. Active projects can be archived here once they are completed.

docs.title: Documents
docs.text:
The Documents page is a library where users can store project-related documents. Users have the ability to create headers, such as WPS, elder Certificates, Parent Materials, and Filler Material Certificates, and group documents under them for easy organization.

In addition, users can save headers as templates for use in future projects. This enables users to quickly and easily organize project-related documents without having to recreate headers and groups each time.

docs.title: Project overview
docs.text:
The project overview serves as the main page for each project and is composed of several key sections:

  • Project details (A): This section displays information about the project, including the project name, project number, customer name, reference, parent material traceability, filler material traceability, description, and creation timestamp.
  • Project participants (B): This section displays a list of project participants along with their assigned roles. Participants can be selected from the app's user list.
  • Activities (C): This section provides a list of the project's latest activities, keeping users informed of the most recent project developments.

docs.title: Reports
docs.text:
You can generate and access project reports from the reports page. These reports are in PDF format and contain the project information and documents compiled into a single PDF file. The table in this section automatically lists each generated report along with its version number. The table also includes a link to the PDF file, as well as information about who created the report, when it was created, any notes associated with it, and its approval status.

You can also approve reports from this section. Once a project is approved, the approval status will change from "Pending" to "Approved", and the name of the approver will be displayed.

docs.title: Weld details
docs.text:
When a weld is selected, users can access detailed information about the weld, which is divided into the following sections:

  • Summary (A): This section displays important information about the weld, including its number, parent, and filler materials used, attachments, and the current status of the welding and heat treatment processes. You can open the attachment to a new tab by clicking on its name.
  • Events (B): This section provides a comprehensive overview of all the events that have been performed for this weld, including the time of the event, who logged it, and who performed it. These events include welding, heat treatment, and NDT inspection. Users can log new events from this section using the Log button. This button is dynamic and changes according to the next required event, and is dependent on the role of the participant. For example, only the welder can log a welding event, while an NDT inspector cannot.
  • Weld Photos (C): This section allows users to upload photos related to the weld, such as images of the finished weld. These photos can be easily accessed and viewed by project participants, ensuring that everyone has access to the latest information related to the project.

By providing detailed information about each weld and the associated events, users can monitor the progress of each weld, ensuring accurate documentation and traceability throughout the welding process.

docs.title: Weld log details
docs.text:
Users can view detailed information about the weld log and the welds added to it on the Weld log details page.

  • Weld Log Details (A): This section displays information about the weld log, including its name, status, progress with respect to welding and heat treatment, attachments, comments on attachments, description, and creation timestamp. You can open the attachment to a new tab by clicking on its name.
  • Weld List (B): This table provides a list of the welds that have been added to the weld log. For each weld, the table displays information such as the weld number, parent and filler materials used, position, WPS (Welding Procedure Specification), welding and heat treatment status, and last activity. Users can click on a specific weld to view additional details.

By providing detailed information about each weld and the overall progress of welding and heat treatment for a given set of welds, users can easily monitor the project's progress and ensure accurate documentation and traceability.

docs.title: Weld logs
docs.text:
Weld logs consist of one or more welds that are grouped together. These logs enable users to track the welding and heat treatment progress for specific sets of welds. Users can also attach documents, such as welding drawings, to a weld log for easy reference.

To see the weld log details and view the welds contained within a weld log, click on the corresponding log. This will provide access to all of the welds associated with that particular log.

docs.title: General
docs.text: Users can access their profile page and profile settings, as well as log out from the app by clicking the user menu (A) in the top right corner.

docs.title: User profile
docs.text: The user profile provides information about the user, including their profile photo, name, email address, role (admin/user), status, date of account activation, and last sign-in time. It enables users to view and manage their personal information in a centralized location, providing a means to keep their accounts up-to-date.
